page.title: 20THE FLAMSTEAD AREA
page.content: Flamstead village is situated about 30 miles north of London on a section of the Chiltern Hills overlooking the old Roman Watling Street,the village being 9 miles from Verulamium,now called St.Albans.It is close to the M1,the first major motorway in Britain.The land use is mostly agricultural but there is industry nearby at Luton(the airport and Vauxhall Motors).Flamstead has its own church,chapel,public houses,Post Office and shop.There is a village school and a private school in a park 2 miles from the village.The area is of interest to tourists through its nearness to London,Woburn, Verulamium,Whipsnade Zoo and various historic sites.These days most working adults commute to the surrounding towns and also to London.
